a.g: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief] until there came to them clear evidence -
A Messenger from Allah, reciting purified scriptures
Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided until after there had come to them clear evidence.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
If there were nothing before the dead except the terror of that blowing, it would be worthy of being feared, for it is a blowing and a cry by which those in the heavens and the earth are struck unconscious, meaning they die by it, except whom Allah wills, and that is some of the angels. Therefore, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'How can I enjoy comfort when the possessor of the Trumpet (Soor) has taken the horn in his mouth, lowered his forehead, and inclined his ear, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow?' [144] Muqatil said: The Trumpet (Soor) is the horn, and that is because Israfil (upon him be peace) has placed his mouth on the horn like the shape of a trumpet, and the circumference of the head of the horn is like the expanse of the heavens and the earth, and he is fixing his gaze toward the Throne (Arsh), waiting for when he will be commanded to blow the first blowing. When he blows, those in the heavens and the earth are struck unconscious, meaning every living creature dies from the intensity of the terror, except whom Allah wills, and that is Jibril, Mika'il, Israfil, and the Angel of Death (Malak al-Mawt). Then the Angel of Death is commanded to take the soul (Ruh) of Jibril, then the soul (Ruh) of Mika'il, then the soul (Ruh) of Israfil, then the Angel of Death is commanded and he dies. Then the creation remains after the first blowing in the Intermediate State (Barzakh) for forty years. Then Allah, the Exalted, revives Israfil and commands him to blow the second blowing, and that is His saying, the Exalted: 'Then it will be blown into it another time, and behold, they are standing, looking.' [Quran 39:68] On their feet, looking at the Resurrection (Ba'ath). And the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'When I was sent, I was sent to the possessor of the Trumpet (Soor), and he brought it to his mouth, advanced one foot and delayed another, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow. Indeed, fear the blowing!' [145] So reflect on the creation and their humiliation, their brokenness, and their submission at the time of being raised, out of fear of this striking unconscious and waiting for it.

a.g: And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the correct religion.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
Patience (Sabr) upon obedience is patience upon hardships, and the obedient one needs patience upon his obedience in three states: The first is before the obedience, and that is in correcting the intention (Niyyah) and sincerity (Ikhlas) and patience from the impurities of showing off (Riya) and the motives of afflictions, and resolving upon sincerity (Ikhlas) and fulfillment. That is from the severe patience for one who knows the reality of the intention (Niyyah) and sincerity (Ikhlas) and the afflictions of showing off (Riya) and the tricks of the Soul (Nafs). And He (peace be upon him) alerted when he said (peace be upon him): 'Indeed, deeds are by intentions, and for every person is what he intended.' And Allah the Exalted said: 'And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, being sincere (Mukhlisin) to Him in the religion (Deen), upright (Hunafa'), and to establish the prayer (Salah) and give the charity (Zakah). And that is the religion (Deen) of the straightness (Al-Qayyimah).' And for this reason, Allah the Exalted gave precedence to patience (Sabr) over the deed, so He the Exalted said: 'Except those who are patient (Sabaru) and do righteous deeds.'

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Intention, Sincerity, and Truthfulness
We praise Allah with the praise of the thankful ones, and we believe in Him with the belief of the certain ones, and we affirm His Oneness (Tawhid) with the affirmation of the truthful ones, and we testify that there is no god but Allah, Lord of the worlds, Creator of the heavens and the earths, and He has obligated the jinn, mankind, and the close angels to worship Him with the worship of the sincere ones. So He, the Exalted, said: 'And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the correct religion.' (Quran 98:5) So for Allah is only the pure, firm religion, for He is the richest of the rich from partnership of associates. And prayers upon His Prophet Muhammad, master of the messengers, and upon all the prophets, and upon his family and his pure, purified companions. Now then, it has been revealed to the possessors of hearts (Qulub) through the insight of faith and the lights of the Quran that there is no attainment of happiness except through knowledge and worship. So all people are perished except the knowers, and all the knowers are perished except the doers, and all the doers are perished except the sincere ones, and the sincere ones are in great danger.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Intention, Sincerity, and Truthfulness
The virtue of sincerity (Ikhlas). Allah the Exalted said: (And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, being sincere (mukhlisÄ«n) to Him in religion) and He said: (Indeed, for Allah is the pure religion) and He the Exalted said: (Except those who repent and reform and hold fast to Allah and make their religion sincere (akhlaá¹£Å«) for Allah) and He the Exalted said: (So whoever hopes for the meeting with his Lord, let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone) - it was revealed concerning one who works for Allah and loves to be praised for it. And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: (Three things do not cause the heart (qalb) of a Muslim man to be treacherous: sincerity (ikhlas) of action for Allah)[36]. And from Mus'ab ibn Sa'd from his father, he said: My father thought he had superiority over those below him among the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, so the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: (Indeed, Allah the Mighty and Majestic supports this nation through its weak ones and their supplication and their sincerity (ikhlas))[37]. And from al-Hasan, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: (Allah the Exalted says: Sincerity (al-Ikhlas) is a secret from My secrets which I have deposited in the heart (qalb) of whom I love from My servants)[38]. And 'Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah honor his face, said: (Do not be concerned with the smallness of action, but be concerned with acceptance, for the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Mu'adh ibn Jabal: Make the action sincere (akhliá¹£), and a little of it will suffice you)[39]. And he, peace be upon him, said: (There is no servant who makes his action sincere (yukhliá¹£) for Allah for forty days except that the springs of wisdom appear from his heart (qalb) upon his tongue)[40].

a.g: Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.
Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.

Their reward with Allah will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.
